title: BBC Local Live: Lancashire on Tuesday 27 September 2016 - BBC News
summary: owners of alton towers fined £ 5m over smiler crash .
lancashire council 'will run out of money ' by 2019 , warns accountancy firm .
woman arrested on sus of conspiring to murder a man in accrington is bailed .
fa to investigate allegations about england and former rovers boss sam allardyce .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates from lancashire have finished for the day , but we will be back from 08:00 on wednesday with the latest news , sport , weather and travel from across the region .
you can contact us via email , facebook or twitter .

documents.title: weather : windy with outbreaks of rain towards dawn
text: tonight will start with dry and clear spells .
a westerly wind will be strong along the coast and the cloud will thicken in the west towards dawn , with outbreaks of patchy rain .
more from bbc weather
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: gay burnley fan says he would meet striker banned for homophobic tweets
text: a gay burnley fan says he would be willing to meet club striker andre gray after the player has completed his four-match suspension for comments made on social media .
the striker is currently banned by the fa for homophobic comments he posted back in 2012 when he played for non-league hinckley united .
he was also given a £ 25,000 fine and has been told to attend an fa education course .
andre has apologised for the tweets .
radio one 's newsbeat has been speaking to burnley fan kevin robinson about what he thinks about andre gray .
when i first heard the news it was almost like a punch in the gut .
it would be a really good thing to meet andre gray and chat to him , talk to him about his feelings .
author: BBC Newsbeat

documents.title: alton towers chief : 'we let people down '
text: alton towers operator merlin has admitted they `` let people down with devastating consequences '' after they were fined £ 5m for the smiler rollercoaster crash .

nick varney , chief executive for merlin entertainments plc , said the company and alton towers were `` not emotionless corporate entities '' , and he repeated his `` heartfelt apologies '' to victims of the crash last june .
sixteen people were injured including two teenage girls who underwent leg amputations .
mr varney added : `` from the beginning the company has accepted full responsibility for the terrible accident . ''

documents.title: football : grayson unconcerned by preston league position
text: the preston manager , simon grayson , says he is not paying too much attention to their current league placing .
friday 's 1-0 win over wigan moved north end three points clear of the championship relegation zone .
preston face birmingham at st andrews this evening .
you can hear commentary on the game from 19:45 , on bbc radio lancashire .
author: BBC Lancashire Sport

documents.title: latest headlines for lancashire
text: latest headlines for lancashire

documents.title: alton towers operator merlin fined £ 5m over smiler crash
text: alton towers operator merlin has been fined £ 5m for the crash on the smiler rollercoaster .
sixteen people were injured in the june 2015 crash , including vicky balch from leyland who needed a leg amputation .
in april , merlin attractions operations ltd admitted breaching the health and safety act .
the theme park originally said the accident was caused by `` human error . ''
but prosecutors argued the fault was with the employer not individuals .

documents.title: weather : breezy with outbreaks of sunshine
text: brighter conditions should move in from the north west through the afternoon with some sunshine , although the breeze will be strong .
tonight will be dry with clear spells .
the westerly wind will be strong along the coast and cloud will thicken in the west towards dawn with patchy rain here .
more from bbc weather
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: council 'will run out of money ' by 2019 , accountancy firm warns
text: an independent review of lancashire county council 's finances has concluded that the authority will run out of money in the next three years .
the review .
by financial consultants pricewaterhouse cooper looked at the resources the authority needs to deliver its statutory services .
these include providing care for the elderly and vulnerable , safeguarding of young people , and highways maintenance .
the report forecasts that the council 's reserves , which are currently being used to balance the budget , will run out by 2019 .
deputy leader david borrow said the position is not sustainable and called on the government to rethink council funding .

documents.title: woman bailed over death of accrington man
text: a woman arrested on sus of conspiracy to murder following the death of a man in accrington has been bailed .
mohammed yousaf , 65 , was found with serious head injuries at a flat in granville road last wednesday and was pronounced dead at the scene .
the 37-year-old woman , from todmorden , was bailed until 3 november .
muhammed arif , of washington street , accrington , has been charged with murder and is due to appear before preston crown court tomorrow .

documents.title: football : blackburn offer marshall new contract
text: blackburn rovers have offered winger ben marshall a new contract with his current deal set to expire at the end of the season .
the 25-year-old moved to ewood park from leicester city in 2013 .
rovers turned down bids for marshall from wolves and fulham during the last transfer window .
we 've sent a new proposal to ben and his representative and they 're deliberating over that .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: more people die of drug misuse in two lancashire authority areas than on the roads
text: analysis from bbc news has found there are 10 times as many deaths through drug misuse compared to collisions on the roads in parts of england and wales .
figures show blackpool came second in the table , while blackburn with darwen was eighth .
the figures show drug misuse deaths outnumbered road fatalities in three quarters of local authority areas between 2013 and 2015 .
public health england ( phe ) said it needed to ensure the most vulnerable drug users could access treatment .

documents.title: latest headlines for lancashire
text: latest headlines for lancashire

documents.title: analysis : future of england boss sam allardyce 'faces real scrutiny '
text: here are some of my thoughts following the news that the fa is investigating allegations england manager and former blackburn boss sam allardyce offered advice on how to `` get around '' rules on player transfers .
one aspect to the story - and you do n't get it from the headline - is that allardyce repeatedly said he would have to get it cleared by the fa .
his exact quote was 'i 'll have to run it by the powers that be ' .
that 's in terms of what he was allegedly being offered .
however , it 's still very serious for the fa .
it 's uncomfortable and it 's embarrassing for allardyce , just two months into a two-year deal as manager .
i think his future at the moment faces real scrutiny .
some may say his job is under threat .
that 's what the fa will have to decide .
is it a question of poor judgement or something more serious ?
the next 24 hours are going to be very , very interesting .
author: Ian Dennis
Senior football reporter

documents.title: alton towers : engineer under 'pressure ' to get ride back into service
text: leyland woman vicky balch , then 19 , was in the front row of the smiler ride when it crashed at alton towers , causing life-changing injuries .
operator merlin attractions has been fined £ 5m after admitting health and safety breaches over the incident in june last year .
the company was sentenced after the court heard that an engineer `` felt pressure '' to get smiler back into service after it developed a fault shortly before the devastating crash .
stafford crown court heard that the victims watched with `` disbelief and horror '' before ploughing into an empty carriage , with the impact likened to a `` 90mph car crash '' .
a total of 16 people were injured , with vicky balch later admitting `` she feared she would die '' from her injuries .
one of her legs had to be amputated .

documents.title: breakingalton towers operator fined £ 5m over smiler crash
text: the operator of alton towers has been fined £ 5m after admitting health and safe breaches over a rollercoaster accident which left a leyland woman needing her leg amputated .
more to follow .

documents.title: woman raped in chorley
text: a woman has been raped in chorley .
police were called to reports a 24-year-old had been attacked in harpers lane at about 02:30 on sunday .
an investigation is under way .

documents.title: allardyce allegations to be investigated by fa
text: the football association is to investigate claims the england manager , sam allardyce , used his position to offer advice on how to `` get around '' rules on player transfers .
the former blackburn rovers boss was filmed by undercover reporters from the daily telegraph who were posing as businessmen .
allardyce has yet to comment on the allegations .

documents.title: latest headlines for lancashire
text: latest headlines for lancashire

documents.title: crash causes blackburn gas leak
text: a crash has caused a gas leak in blackburn .
two cars crashed in the early hours of the morning and it 's thought one of them hit the gas supply of an empty shop in wensley road .
no-one was trapped in either vehicle .
a police cordon was in place while national grid carried out repairs .

documents.title: labour pledges to ban fracking
text: a future labour government would ban fracking in england , shadow energy secretary barry gardiner has said .
speaking at labour conference , he said fracking , which involves gas being extracted from shale rock , would make the uk dependent on fossil fuels when the priority should be clean energy .
the government says it could provide the uk with greater energy security and create jobs .
a decision on whether fracking will be allowed to take place at little plumpton and roseacre wood is expected .

documents.title: tributes paid to barman killed in head-on smash
text: a barman described as `` one of life 's true gentlemen '' has died in a head-on collision .
author: Lancashire Telegraph

documents.title: man jailed for causing son 's brain damage
text: a father whose drunken attack left his newborn son with severe brain damage has been jailed .
tomasz raszkiewicz `` forcibly lunged '' at lucasz gal 's mother as she held him in her arms , causing the baby to fracture his skull on a door at the couple 's flat in blackpool .
lucasz ' `` catastrophic '' injuries mean he will have `` no quality of life '' , preston crown court heard .
raszkiewicz , 33 , admitted wounding or inflicting gbh with intent and was jailed for three years and two months .

documents.title: football : dyche delighted with burnley display
text: burnley boss sean dyche praised his side 's performance after the clarets beat watford 2-0 at turf moor last night .
burnley led through club record signing jeff hendrick , with michael keane adding the second shortly after the break .
the win has moved dyche 's side up to 13th in the premier league .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live coverage
text: welcome to lancashire live .
we 're here until 16:00 with the latest local news , sport , travel and weather updates from across the county .
you can get in touch with all your photographs and snippets of news by email , facebook or twitter .
author: Jon Lowe
Reporter, BBC News Online
